contents.content: UNIT 03 面试礼仪 Interview Etiquette
Lesson 5 道别礼仪 Departiing Etiiquette
杰克和玛丽在讨论面试中的道别场景。

contents.title: 杰克：当面试接近尾声，求职者不免会松口气。
contents.answer: When the interview finally comes to an end, the interviewee will probably breathe a sigh of relief.

contents.title: 玛丽：不过，也不能掉以轻心，一些细节还是要注意的。
contents.answer: Still, you should not let down your guard. Some details should be paid attention to.

contents.title: 杰克：这时候可以再次感谢对方给予此次面试机会。
contents.answer: At this moment you can thank the interviewer again for the opportunity of the interview.

contents.title: 玛丽：也可以向面试官询问自己今天的表现如何。
contents.answer: You can also ask the interviewer about your performance today.

contents.content: 面试结束语说什么？面试结束后怎么做？面试时我们总想有个好的开场，却大多忘了也同样需要一个完美的结尾。当面试结束时，你会不会一转身就走了，也许加了句“谢谢”“再见”的礼貌用语，然后不卑不亢地故作镇静，回去静心等候通知。如果你在“谢谢”之前再说一句变被动为主动的话，也许你的等待不会漫漫无期。

contents.title: 杰克：别忘记诚恳地询问，什么时候可以得到答复。
contents.answer: Don't forget to ask when you can receive a reply.

contents.title: 玛丽：如果必要，最好询问一下是否需要二次面试。
contents.answer: And it's the best to ask about the second interview if necessary.

contents.title: 杰克：你要礼貌地表示自己会耐心等待结果。
contents.answer: You should state politely that you will wait for the results patiently.

contents.title: 玛丽：你可以询问有关此次所应聘职位的信息。
contents.answer: You can ask questions about the position you are applying for.

contents.title: 杰克：这样的话，要记得为对方的答复表示感谢。
contents.answer: In this case, you should remember to give thanks for the reply you get.

contents.content: 在面试结束前，可以谦虚地请教面试官：“您认为我今天的表现如何？录取的机率有多大？”通常，这个问题也会让对方认为，你对这份工作抱有很大的期望，而你也可以试着从对方的回答中，约略猜测出自己成功的机率有多大，以作为下一次面试时的参考。

contents.title: 玛丽：这是当然的。
contents.answer: Of course.

contents.title: 杰克：离开时记得向面试官道别。
contents.answer: Just say goodbye to the interviewer before you leave.

contents.title: 玛丽：别忘记写封邮件，或是打电话致谢。
contents.answer: Besides, remember to make acknowledgments through an E-mail or a call.

contents.title: 1.谢谢您给我这个机会与您面谈。
contents.answer: Thank you for the opportunity to have an interview with you.

contents.title: 2.如果我想知道您的决定，什么时候可以与您联络？
contents.answer: When should I contact you if I want to know your decision?

contents.title: 3.您认为我什么时候能得到您的消息？
contents.answer: When do you think I will hear from you?

contents.title: 4.期待您的尽早回音。
contents.answer: I'm looking forward to your reply at your earliest convenience.

contents.title: 5.我不知道该如何表达对您的感激之情。
contents.answer: I don't know how to show my gratitude to you.

contents.title: 6.我还需要第二次面试吗？
contents.answer: And do I need a second interview?

contents.title: 7.我会耐心等你的决定。
contents.answer: I'm willing to wait until you have come to a decision.

contents.title: 8.与您交谈让我感到很愉快。
contents.answer: It is fun to have a talk with you.

contents.title: 9.当面试接近尾声，你也不该掉以轻心。
contents.answer: When the interview comes to an end, you should not let down your guard.

contents.title: 10.面试结束后，要记得致谢。
contents.answer: Don't forget to make acknowledgments after an interview.

contents.content: come to an end 接近尾声
breathe a sigh of relief 松口气
let down one's guard 掉以轻心
in this case 这样的话
